intro: Vellozia caruncularis, commonly known as the woolly vellozia, is a distinctive member of the Restionaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spike-like clusters. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
